name: df-cfil
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(ccfil, cmpt(s0, cuni(crn(cxmet)), crab(s1, cfv(cfil, cdm(cdm(cv(s0)))), wral(s2, crp, wrex(s3, cv(s1), wss(cima(cv(s0), cxp(cv(s3), cv(s3))), co(nat0, cico, cv(s2))))))))
comment: Define the set of Cauchy filters on a given extended metric space. A Cauchy filter is a filter on the set such that for every ` 0 < x ` there is an element of the filter whose metric diameter is less than ` x ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Oct-2015.)
